title.narrative: Weoog Paani pro-poor forestry in Burkina Faso 2019-2023
Weoog Paani pro-poor forestry in Burkina Faso 2019-2023

description.narrative: The development objective is "Sustainable improvement of the living conditions of the rural population in the target zones through improved governance of forest resources, investments in the forests and the valorization of non-timber forest products while contributing to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals" ("Amélioration durable des conditions de vie des populations rurales de la zone d’intervention du projet à travers la promotion de la gouvernance locale des ressources forestières, les investissements dans les forêts et la valorisation des PFNLs et ce dans l’optique de la réalisation des Objectifs du Développement Durable"). The specific objectives refer to improved local forest governance, improved sylviculture and increased income for vulnerable households and are formulated as follows: 1: Promote an enabling environment for local governance of forest resources in 25 municipalities in 5 regions 2: Strengthen the regeneration, preservation and production capacities of forest areas 3: Increase the incomes of actors through the improved economic importance of forest resources

Projektet GLRF (Gestion Locale des Ressources Forestières/Lokal skogsförvaltning) i Burkina Faso syftar till att stödja tillämpningen i större skala (25 landsbygdskommuner) av den modell för lokal skogsförvaltning som den icke-statliga organisationen (NGO) Tree Aid utvecklat och testat i 8 landsbygdskommuner i Burkina Faso. Modellen innehåller främst följande steg:
- Kartläggning av resurser genom skogsinventering och markkartering - Socio-ekonomiska enkäter - Utarbetande av skogsbruksplaner med deltagande av intressenter (byföreningar, lokala småföretag, kommunrepresentanter etc) - Förnyelse av skog och stärkt skogsproduktion tillsammans med annan icke-statlig organisation, byorganisationer, statliga skogsrådgivare och skogsforskare - Anläggande av mikrovattenfördämningar i skogarna i avsikt att öka CO2-upptag, stärka biologisk mångfald och öka skogsprodutionen - Marknadsstudier för att identifiera värdekedjor (produkter) med ekonomisk potential och med relevans för sårbara hushåll - Stärkande av värdekedjor (produktion - förädling - marknadsföring) - Stöd till lokala småföretag och främjande av hållbara mikrofinanslösningar för dessa
Kvinnor och ungdomar ges ett särskilt fokus. Utbildning av såväl lokala grupper, småföretagare som representanter för kommun respektive stat är en viktig del av projektet. Statliga aktörer deltar dels genom miljöministeriets ordförandeskap i projektets styrkommitté, dels genom att statliga (främst skogliga) rådgivningsorgan agerar enligt sina mandat och normala roller.
Projektet genomförs av ett konsortium av tre organisationer: - Tree Aid - en internationell icke vinstdrivande NGO med säte i England och specialiserad på lokal skogsförvaltning - SNV - en internationell NGO med stor erfarenhet av privatsektorutveckling (inkl värdekedjor) inom jordbruk i Afrika - United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) - ett FN-organ med lång bakgrund inom mikrofinans i Burkina Faso
Projektets aktivitetsperiod löper från 1 juni 2019 till 31 maj 2021. Sverige bidrar - såsom ensam givare - med 79 miljoner kr, varav 1 miljon kr hanteras direkt av ambassaden för revisioner, utvärdering och uppföljning.

The project GLRF (Gestion Locale des Ressources Forestières/Local forest management) in Burkina Faso aims at implementing at a large scale (25 rural communes) the local forest management model that the non-governmental organization Tree Aid has developed and tested in 8 rual communes in Burkina Faso. The model contains the follwing main steps:
- Mapping of resources through forest inventories and land maps - Socio-economic surveys - Preparation of forest management plans together with local stakeholders (NGO, community organizations, local small enterprises, commune representatives etc) - Forest regeneration and improved forest production together with village organisations, forest extension services and forest researchers - Establishment of micro water dams in the forests in order to increase CO2 sequestration, increase biological diversity and increase forest production - Market studies to identify value chains with economic potential and relevance for vulnerable households - Strengthening of value chains (production - processing - marketing) - Support to local small enterprises och promotion of sustainable micro finance solutions
The Project particularly focuses on women and youth. Capacity building of local groups, small businesses and representatives of communes and government services is an important part of the Project. The government takes responsibility for the Project by the Ministry of Environment's chairmanship of the Project Steering Committee and by the role of its extension services at regional and local level.
The Project is implemented by a Consortium of three organizations: - Tree Aid - an international non-profit NGO with its head office in the United Kingdom and specialized on local forest governance - SNV - an international NGO with broad experience in Africa of private sector & value chain development in agriculture - The United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) - a UN organization with a long background within micro-finance in Burkina Faso
The Project's activity period will last from 1 June 2019 to 31 May 2021. Sweden is the sole donor and provides a budget of 79 million SEK, of which 1 million SEK will be handled by the Embassy i Ouagadougou for audits, follow-up and evaluation.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: - As usual, the Annual 2019 Narrative Report delivered by Tree Aid - for the period 20190601 - 20191231) is well structured on the basis of the results framework, easy to read and include relevant information. - The report was delivered on time. - In general, the project progresses according to plans with an exception for component 3 (development of value chains and business activities), see below. - The project experienced delays during these first 7 months, especially on component 3, due to complications in the negociation of the contract between Tree Aid and UNCDF. However, this is not alarming, since the UNCDF activities are dependent on studies to be carried out by the other consortium members Tree Aid and SNV and should only have started towards the end of 2019 anyhow. The Embassy has been informed that the UNCDF contract was signed in January 2020 and that activities have moved ahead fast since then. - The detoriorating security situation is another cause for delays in the implementation generally in the contribution. However, the mitigation measures (working through local organizations, change of targeted communes & forests etc) taken by Tree Aid seem to have been effective. - The Embassy has noted with satisfaction that most of the initially planned activities have started and are progressing well. These activities cover recruitment, the preparation of Manuals for Monitoring and Evaluation as well as Administrative and Financial procedures, capacity building involvement of mayors (the network of municipalities) and other actors through workshops, the development of municipal action plans, the establishment of the government Committee to review the legal texts on forest taxation, the establishment of the Directory of Village Forest Enterprises (662 VFEs), studies on the sites for the boulies (traditional water reservoirs), the planting of 510,000 trees, the training of 996 monitors of improved stoves, the construction of 36,000 improved stoves, numerous follow-up field missions, implementation of almost all of the recommendations of the organizational audit, etc. - It is also noted that the preparation of the revised Project Document to cover the period up to 31 May 2024 is advancing well with the participation of a broad range of stakeholders. - The activities funded by the additional 30 million SEK transferred to Tree Aid in September 2019 for the purpose of strengthening climate change mitigation are advancing well. The activities are focused on (i) establishment of approximately 150 traditional rainwater dams inside the forests covered by the project in order to boost bioversity and forest growth and (ii) increased use of improved wood stoves that reduce the use of fuelwood. - The 2020 Annual Review meeting between the Embassy and the consortium, led by Tree Aid is planned for end June. It will be held as a virtual meeting.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
